block.p: Pioneer League MISSOULA OSPREY--Announced the extension of their player development contract with the Arizona Diamondbacks through the 2004 season.
Pioneer League MISSOULA OSPREY--Announced the extension of their player development contract with the Arizona Diamondbacks through the 2004 season.

National Hockey League COLUMBUS BLUE JACKETS--Signed D Tyler Sloan. Reassigned G Greg Gardner, D Jonas Junkka and C Reggie Savage to Syracuse of the AHL. Released D Jeff Ware. Assigned RW Matt Davidson, LW Sean Selmser, RW Scott Hollis, LW Mathieu Darche and C Jeff Williams to Syracuse. DALLAS STARS--Assigned C Gregor Baumgartner, C Eric Houde, LW Brad Lauer, LW Steve Gainey, LW Michael Christian, RW John Purves, RW David Ling, D Evgueni Tsybouk, D Jeff Tory, D Pat Neaton, D Jeff McKercher and G Chad Alban to Utah of the IHL and G Doug Teskey to Fort Wayne of the UHL. EDMONTON OILERS--Agreed to terms with LW Ryan Smyth on a three-year contract. FLORIDA PANTHERS--Reassigned C Eric Boguniecki to Louisville of the AHL. LOS ANGELS KINGS--Reassigned RW Scott Thomas to Manitoba of the IHL. Reassigned D Joe Corvo, D Michael Pudlick, LW David Hymovitz, RW Kevin Baker, RW Nate Miller and RW Jason Podollan to Lowell of the AHL. OTTAWA SENATORS--Assigned G Mathieu Chouinard, LW Derek King, F Konstantin Gorovikov and F Chris Neil to Grand Rapids of the IHL. PITTSBURGH PENGUINS--Signed F Kip Miller and G Jean-Sebastien Aubin. Assigned G Craig Hillier, G Joel Laing, G Brant Nicklin, G Mark Scally, D Brendan Buckley, D Sven Butenschon, D Trent Cull, D Andrew Ference, D Chris Kelleher, D Kevin Magnuson, D Mark Moore, D Chris Newans, D Doug Schmidt, D John Slaney, D Jean-Philippe Soucy, F Eric Bellerose, F Greg Crozier, F Jan Fadrny, F Dylan Gyori, F Quinn Hancock, F Alexie Kolkunov, F Tom Kostopoulos, F Jason MacDonald, F Alexandre Matthiew, F Eric Meloche, F Steven Parsons, F Toby Peterson, F Alexei Podalinski, F Boris Protsenko, F Joel Scherban, F Martin Sonnenerg, F Darcy Verot and F Alexander Zevakhin to Wilkes-Barre-Scranton of the AHL. WASHINGTON CAPITALS--Signed D Ryan Vanvuskirk to a three-year contract.
